author: Not available
source: The Complete Corpus of Anglo-Saxon Poetry

text.0: Verba mea auribus percipe, domine; intellege clamorem meum.
text.1: Word þu min onfoh,           wuldres ealdor,
text.2: and mid earum gehyr,           ece drihten.
text.3: Intende uoci orationis mææ, rex meus et deus meus.
text.4: þu eart min cyning           and eac ece god.
text.5: Quoniam ad te orabo: Domine, mane exaudies uocem meam.
text.6: Forðon ic to ðe,           ece drihten,
text.7: soðum gebidde,           and ðu symble gehyr
text.9: Mane adstabo tibi et uidebo, quoniam nos deus uolens iniquitatem tu es.
text.10: Ic þe æt stande           ær on morgen
text.11: and ðe sylfne geseo;           forðon ic to soðe wat
text.12: þæt ðu unriht ne wilt           ænig, drihten.
